description: From Middle English *ademen, from Old English ādēman (“to judge, adjudge, doom, deem, try, adjudicate”); equivalent to a- +‎ deem.

verbs.description: addeem (third-person singular simple present addeems, present participle addeeming, simple past and past participle addeemed)

entries.meaning: (transitive, now rare, archaic) To adjudge; to try, test. [from 8th c.]
examples: Legacy is not addeemed by gift before execution of will.

entries.meaning: (transitive, obsolete) To deem; think; judge; esteem; account; determine; be of an opinion.
